dcterms:creator: L. Specia
S. Frank
K. Sima’an
D. Elliott
dcterms:description: A dataset containing 30,000 sentence pairs that briefly describe Flickr captions, often referred to as Multi30k. It is characterized by shorter and simpler sentences compared to larger datasets.
dcterms:title: Multi30k

dcterms:creator: M. Cettolo
J. Niehues
S. Stüker
L. Bentivogli
R. Cattoni
M. Federico
dcterms:description: A dataset consisting of 209,772 sentence pairs from transcribed TED presentations, covering a wide variety of topics with conversational language.
dcterms:title: IWSLT 2016

dcterms:description: A large dataset from the news translation shared task containing roughly 7 million sentence pairs derived from web crawl data, news articles, and European Parliament proceedings.
dcterms:title: WMT 2017

dcterms:creator: R. Socher
A. Perelygin
J. Wu
J. Chuang
C. Manning
A. Ng
C. Potts
dcterms:description: A dataset comprising movie reviews and their sentiment, used for sentiment analysis. The binary version contains roughly 56,400 reviews.
dcterms:title: Stanford Sentiment Treebank (SST)

dcterms:creator: A. L. Maas
R. E. Daly
P. T. Pham
D. Huang
A. Y. Ng
C. Potts
dcterms:description: A dataset containing 25,000 multi-sentence movie reviews used for sentiment analysis, truncated to the first 200 words.
dcterms:title: IMDb

dcterms:creator: E. M. Voorhees
D. M. Tice
dcterms:description: A dataset of open-domain, fact-based questions divided into broad semantic categories, used for question classification.
dcterms:title: TREC

dcterms:creator: S. R. Bowman
G. Angeli
C. Potts
C. D. Manning
dcterms:description: A large annotated corpus for learning natural language inference, consisting of premise-hypothesis pairs.
dcterms:title: Stanford Natural Language Inference Corpus (SNLI)

dcterms:creator: P. Rajpurkar
J. Zhang
K. Lopyrev
P. Liang
dcterms:description: A large-scale question answering dataset with question-answer pairs associated with paragraphs from English Wikipedia.
dcterms:title: Stanford Question Answering Dataset (SQuAD)
